You are given $n$ chores, where the $i$-th chore takes $a_i$ units of time to complete.  It is guaranteed that $a_i \ge a_{i-1}$ for all $i$. You can choose up to $k$ chores to complete in $x$ units of time instead of their original time.  Find the minimum time required to complete all $n$ chores.

Input:

* The first line contains three integers $n$, $k$, and $x$ ($1 \le k \le n \le 100$, $1 \le x \le 99$).
* The second line contains $n$ integers $a_i$ ($2 \le a_i \le 100$).

Output:

* Print one integer representing the minimum time required to complete all chores.
You have a list of tasks that take a certain amount of time to complete. You can choose a number of tasks to complete in a shorter amount of time. Find the minimum total time to complete all tasks.
